document.title: Tutorial Step 4
document.paragraph:
This sample builds on the knowledge learnt in the previous tutorials (
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step1/index.xml 1 ,
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step2/index.xml 2 and
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step3/index.xml 3 ) and again demonstrates the use of a ../../../reference/gdi/wel_client_dc_chart.xmlWEL_CLIENT_DC.
step4.png step4
2Compiling
Start Visual Studio .NET
Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <Eiffel_ENViSioN!_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\wel\step4\ and select tutorial_step4.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Launch EiffelStudio.
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Browse to Eiffel54\examples\wel\tutorial\step4\
Choose the Ace file
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.
Click OK.
2Running After launching the sample, you will see a ../../../reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xmlWEL_FRAME_WINDOW displayed. By holding down the left mouse button, and moving the mouse (Within the client area of the window), you will be able to draw on the client area of the window. Pressing the right mouse button within the window will clear the client area of the window.
2Under the Hood
This system is an improvement over tutorial
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step3/index.xml step3 and only uses WEL techniques demonstrated in previous
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/index.xml tutorials to allow you to draw on the client DC of the window.
This sample contains the following classes:
TUTORIAL_STEP4
MAIN_WINDOW
